translations.name: Polish Living New Testament
translations.description:
Słowo Życia, or Word of Life,  is a Protestant paraphrase of the New Testament, was created in the evangelical environment , whose premise is to give the message of Jesus Christ in a modern, intelligible language. This is not a classic translation, because due to the far-reaching dynamism, the translators themselves regard it as a paraphrase of the text. It was published in 1989 by the \"Agape\" Publishing Institute. The Word of Life was developed on the basis of an English translation of the Greek language - Living New Testament and parallel translations in various languages made by Living Bible International - a Swedish Bible organization specializing in dynamic translations. Each book is preceded by a short introduction containing a concise collection of information about each book (authorship, place of writing, time of writing, summary and subject matter).

The last paragraph of the preface is defined by the message of the Word of Life:

\"If this translation helps to deepen the deep and often complex thoughts of the Word of God and to better understand and apply the New Testament text, thus deepening the Christian life of its readers and facilitating imitation of the Lord, this book has achieved its goal.\"
